name: Open-hand-project
body:
The aim of the Open Hand Project is to make robotic prosthetic hands more accessible to amputees.

Leading prosthetics can cost up to $100,000. By using emerging technologies like 3D printing, we can cut that down to under $1000. Thatâ€™s two orders of magnitude cheaper, and means that these devices can reach a far broader audience!

The Open Hand Project is open source and created under the GNU public license V3.0
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
